value.name: Opinion: I have a unique perspective on George Floyd’s death. I lost a family member to police violence.
value.description: I’m one of the siblings of Alfred Olango, who was killed by El Cajon police officer Richard Gonsalves on Sept. 27, 2016. My brother was unarmed, at his breaking point, and in need of proper assistance. He was dealing with the stress of life along with ...

value.name: Opinion: Police are killing Black people like my brother Alfred Olango like clockwork. This has to stop.
value.description: His final seconds touched the hearts of millions. I lost my brother, Alfred Olango, to police brutality in 2016. Richard Gonsalves of the El Cajon Police Department shot my unarmed brother ...

value.name: Chauvin's guilty verdict is a major milestone in America's reckoning with racial justice
value.description: Other Black men killed in 2016 by police were Greg Gunn in Montgomery, Ala.; Joseph Mann in Sacramento, Calif.; Terence Crutcher in Tulsa, Okla.; Keith Scott in Charlotte, N.C.; and Alfred Olango in El Cajon, Calif. A Black woman, Deborah Danner ...

value.name: Chauvin's guilty verdict is a major milestone in America's reckoning with racial justice
value.description: It has been a year of historic antiracism protests unlike anything seen in this country for decades, but Derek Chauvin’s conviction on all three counts gave many Americans some hope that the past need not repeat itself.
